comment.author: 100293193@N06
comment._content: Somewhere in that photo must me my Grandad who was an engineer from early 20th C until mid 1950s, He was engineer in charge of docking the Cutty Sark at Greenwich according to family lore. He could be front row, 3rd from left but... His name was Charles K G Maddox

comment.author: 11334970@N05
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/100293193@N06] Hi pyomri

Charles Maddox was involved in the restoration of the ship in the 1950s – he was even presented to the Queen at the re-opening in 1957! Green & Silley Weir were the company that carried out the restoration on the ship from 1954-1957.
